verses.kjv: And David said, Is there yet any that is left of the house of Saul, that I may shew him kindness for Jonathan’s sake?
verses.ct: David asked, "Is there anyone still remaining from Saul's family that I can show kindness to because of Jonathan?"

verses.kjv: And there was of the house of Saul a servant whose name was Ziba. And when they had called him unto David, the king said unto him, Art thou Ziba? And he said, Thy servant is he.
verses.ct: Now there was a servant from Saul's household named Ziba. When they brought him to David, the king asked him, "Are you Ziba?" He replied, "Yes, I am your servant."

verses.kjv: And the king said, Is there not yet any of the house of Saul, that I may shew the kindness of God unto him? And Ziba said unto the king, Jonathan hath yet a son, which is lame on his feet.
verses.ct: The king asked, "Is there no one left from Saul's family that I can show God's kindness to?" Ziba told the king, "Jonathan still has a son who is crippled in both feet."

verses.kjv: And the king said unto him, Where is he? And Ziba said unto the king, Behold, he is in the house of Machir, the son of Ammiel, in Lodebar.
verses.ct: The king asked him, "Where is he?" Ziba answered, "He's living in the home of Machir son of Ammiel, in Lodebar."

verses.kjv: Then king David sent, and fetched him out of the house of Machir, the son of Ammiel, from Lodebar.
verses.ct: So King David sent for him and had him brought from the home of Machir son of Ammiel in Lodebar.

verses.kjv: Now when Mephibosheth, the son of Jonathan, the son of Saul, was come unto David, he fell on his face, and did reverence. And David said, Mephibosheth. And he answered, Behold thy servant!
verses.ct: When Mephibosheth, the son of Jonathan and grandson of Saul, came to David, he bowed down with his face to the ground in respect. David said, "Mephibosheth." He answered, "Here I am, your servant!"

verses.kjv: And David said unto him, Fear not: for I will surely shew thee kindness for Jonathan thy father’s sake, and will restore thee all the land of Saul thy father; and thou shalt eat bread at my table continually.
verses.ct: David told him, "Don't be afraid. I'm going to show you kindness because of your father Jonathan. I will give back to you all the land that belonged to your grandfather Saul, and you will always eat at my table."

verses.kjv: And he bowed himself, and said, What is thy servant, that thou shouldest look upon such a dead dog as I am?
verses.ct: Mephibosheth bowed low and said, "Who am I, your servant, that you would pay attention to a dead dog like me?"

verses.kjv: Then the king called to Ziba, Saul’s servant, and said unto him, I have given unto thy master’s son all that pertained to Saul and to all his house.
verses.ct: Then the king summoned Ziba, Saul's servant, and told him, "I have given your master's grandson everything that belonged to Saul and his entire family."

verses.kjv: Thou therefore, and thy sons, and thy servants, shall till the land for him, and thou shalt bring in the fruits, that thy master’s son may have food to eat: but Mephibosheth thy master’s son shall eat bread alway at my table. Now Ziba had fifteen sons and twenty servants.
verses.ct: "You, along with your sons and your servants, will farm the land for him and bring in the harvest so that your master's grandson will have income. But Mephibosheth, your master's grandson, will always eat at my table." Now Ziba had 15 sons and 20 servants.

verses.kjv: Then said Ziba unto the king, According to all that my lord the king hath commanded his servant, so shall thy servant do. As for Mephibosheth, said the king, he shall eat at my table, as one of the king’s sons.
verses.ct: Ziba said to the king, "Your servant will do everything my lord the king has commanded." Then the king added, "As for Mephibosheth, he will eat at my table like one of the king's own sons."

verses.kjv: And Mephibosheth had a young son, whose name was Micha. And all that dwelt in the house of Ziba were servants unto Mephibosheth.
verses.ct: Mephibosheth had a young son named Micha. Everyone living in Ziba's household served Mephibosheth.

verses.kjv: So Mephibosheth dwelt in Jerusalem: for he did eat continually at the king’s table; and was lame on both his feet.
verses.ct: So Mephibosheth lived in Jerusalem, because he always ate at the king's table. He was crippled in both feet.
